info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 12 at 2:52PM CDT until April 12 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN BROWN AND NORTHEASTERN COLEMAN COUNTIES... At 251 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Echo, or 7 miles southwest of Burkett, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Burkett around 305 PM CDT. Grosvenor around 315 PM CDT. Cross Cut and Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty around 320 PM CDT. Lake Brownwood around 325 PM CDT. Byrds around 330 PM CDT. Lake Brownwood State Park around 335 PM CDT. May around 350 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Echo, Owens and Thrifty. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
